KnowledgeBase.Title: icompareEQ
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: icompare icompareNE icompareGT icompareGE icompareLT icompareLE

Function.Description: The icompareEQ is a fast comparison function that assume that its operands are Integer values. It returns true if the arguments are equal and false if otherwise.

Brief.Overview: The icompareEQ is a fast comparison function that assume that its operands are Integer values. The resulting value is a Boolean value of true or false. The operands are not checked and are not coerced.
Brief.Usage: Use the icompareEQ function when you wish to compare two Integers and determine if they are equal and you wish the result to be expressed as a Boolean value (true or false). These functions only operate on Integer operands. For a more general, but slower, comparison, use the compareEQ, compareNE, compareGT, compareGE, compareLT, and compareLE which performs type checking and type conversions.

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the comparison is true, false if the comparison is false
